titleStmt.title: The Popes ware-house, laid open to the world: or, A true account how many trades the Pope is on viz. He is a gold-smith, a jeweller, a linnen-draper, a silk-man, a turner, a brazier, an iron-monger, a stone-cutter, a tinker, a vintner, a corn-chandler, a drover, a coach maker, a body-seller, and a soul seller. To which is added Sir William Wallers new discovery of the Popes sham-plot. Entred according to order.

The Popes ware-house, laid open to the world: or, A true account how many trades the Pope is on viz. He is a gold-smith, a jeweller, a linnen-draper, a silk-man, a turner, a brazier, an iron-monger, a stone-cutter, a tinker, a vintner, a corn-chandler, a drover, a coach maker, a body-seller, and a soul seller. To which is added Sir William Wallers new discovery of the Popes sham-plot. Entred according to order.
titleStmt.author: Waller, William, Sir, d. 1699. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for T. Mills and are to be sold by a running book-seller,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
